00063 struct null {
00064     null() {}
00065     template<class T>
00066     operator T*() const {
00067     return 0;
00068     }
00069 
00070     template<class C, class T>
00071     operator T C::*() const {
00072     return 0;
00073     }
00074 private:
00075     null(const null&);
00076     null& operator=(const null&);
00077     void operator&() const;
00078 };
00079 
00080 static struct null null;

00082 class SerializationBuffer;
00083 class DeserializationBuffer;

00094 enum GCPlacement {
00095     UseGC, 
00096     NoGC, 
00097     PointerFreeGC 
00100 };
00101 
00112 class Object {
00113 #ifndef SYLPH_DOXYGEN
00114 public:
00115     Object();
00116     virtual ~Object();
00117     void* operator new( size_t size);
00118     void* operator new( size_t size, GCPlacement gcp);
00119     void* operator new( size_t size, void *p);
00120     void operator delete( void* obj);
00121     void operator delete( void*, GCPlacement);
00122     void operator delete( void*, void*);
00123 
00124     // Arrays from Object are *never* gc'ed, and I recommend using Sylph::Array
00125     // instead. Maybe we should document this somewhere?
00126     void* operator new[](size_t size);
00127     void* operator new[](size_t size, void *p);
00128     void operator delete[](void* obj);
00129     void operator delete[](void*, void*);
00130 
00131 private:
00132     static void cleanup(void* obj, void* clientData);
00133     static bool gc_inited;
00134 #endif
00135 };
00136 
00147 template<class T, class... Args> T * newgc(const Args&... args);
00148 
00156 template<class T> void deletegc(const T * t);
00157 // Undocumented, do not use directly! 
00158 template<class T> void cleanupgc(void *obj, void *displ);
00159 SYLPH_END_NAMESPACE
